title: To theists: If there exists proof that your religion is correct, why hasn't god made this proof more obvious (eg writing on the moon, or a new miracle/prophet every year). If there exists no hard proof, then it's justified to be a non believer or apostate.

author: D_Rich0150
text:
Because God doesn't want people in heaven who do not have the wherewithal to peruse him as instructed. the parables of the wheat and weeds, wheat and chaff, sheep and goats all tell of this world being a place that separates those who truly seek out god and want to worship him from those who rather do their own thing.

if there was always absolute proof many would be forced to believe which kinda destroys the whole point of this world being separate from God's known kingdom.

God does not want you, if you do not want with all your being to be with him.
